member.summary: List of headers which change the response.
member.remarks: Generally, a proxy cache only cares about the host and query string, and disregard the headers. There are cases where the header actually changes the response and the proxy should be instructed. For instance, asking for compressed or uncompressed content; or specifying xml vs json through the Accept header, are common cases. In this service, we only support Json but we can have uncompressed/compressed content.

It returns at most one product; it will return one or more SKUs for this product, each SKU with exactly 1 applicable availability. There is no paging support. It returns at most 25 products; it will return one or more SKUs for this product, each SKU with exactly 1 applicable availability. Only the data for the input market will be returned from MarketProductPropertySet and MarketSKUPropertySet. Only the data for the input market and input language will be returned from LocalizedProductPropertySet and LocalizedSKUPropertySet. This API iterates over the set of product IDs and calls internal Hydrate Product logic for each one. The same filtering for applicable availabilities will be applied on each hydrate call.
member.remarks: See our documentation here for more details

member.summary: This controller returns the ratings information

member.name: M:Microsoft.MarketplaceServices.DisplayCatalog.Frontdoor.Version6.RatingsController.Get(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the set of content ratings.
member.header: Correlation Vector for the request. Must be sent as header or as query string parameter
member.queryParam: The desired market.
A comma separated list of the desired languages used for localized data.
The domain (game, tv, video, application...) to query.
member.returns: A set of rating boards, each containing a set of ratings.
member.remarks: This API returns ratings metadata information. This is essentially "domain data" for ratings, although the ratings data is different from standard domain data and this is why this is a separate endpoint. The API is used to retrieve ratings metadata for a single market and language. Optionally, a domain parameter allows filtering on ratings for a specific media type (application, game, movie, tv). The response object is a dictionary of rating boards, each of which contains a set of ratings. For example, ESRB is a rating board for games containing ratings of ESRB:T and ESRB:E, among others. Each rating and rating board contains a set of market and localized properties. Each rating also contains an age, which represents the minimum age of the user that this content is appropriate for per the rating board. A set of restrictions are defined on the rating to determine what is restricted if a user does not meet the minimum age requirement. There is also a priority defined on each rating board, which determines which rating's minimum age requirement to apply if more than one rating applies to a product (lowest priority numeral wins; i.e., a rating board with priority of 1 wins over a rating board of priority of 2). All rating boards in a market are guaranteed to have a unique priority. For more information about this API or general information about all catalog APIs, refer to the catalog API documentation.
